text: I use this every May and it keeps my hair pretty straight all summer long. If I let it air dry, it's still kind of frizzy, but if I blow it dry and use my large curling iron, it stays straight in humidity- even in drizzle. My bangs don't curl! It's not fun to apply - I have to rinse it so long I run out of hot water and it is smelly, but it is so worth it. Don't put it in your hair right before a special occasion,though - the first week it hangs pretty flat and bodyless. But after a week or two you will love it. I couldn't find it in the stores this year, so I used a regular perm and combed it straight (which I used to do before I discovered the straightener). It didn't turn out nearly as well, so now I have to put up with it for three months and pray that the summer isn't very humid. From now on I will order it online.

This is some of the worst shampoo that I have ever bought for my dreads. Not only is it nearly impossible to get all of the soap out with you shower, but the crap is making me dreads frizzy and causing them to come undone. I have had my dreads for YEARS and never run into something like this. You definitely get what you pay for. I despise the customer service of one of the other company's but it looks like I am going back to them after the bad experience with this garbage. I would give it zero stars but it wont let me.

I have used the renac styling brush for years. I ordered two of the new style not realizing they are not the same brush anymore. Both of them are junk. They have about 50-60% heat as the old style. All of the screws come loose after a few uses. Some of them can be tightened back up but come loose again. The company I used to get these from no longer carry them. They have been in business for over 75 years. Hmmmm.... after using these I can only guess why a reputable company won't sell them anymore. Time to start shopping for a new brand.
I like very much this color because I can use it everyday because it is easy matchable. It is a very nice and natural color.

This is the second set of Conair hot rollers that I've purchased in two years. The first set barely got warm enough to put a little wave in my hair, and my hair curls fairly easily. Finally giving up, I bought this set, hoping for a different result. They are equally as warm as the first and don't curl. Don't listen to the 5-star results. I did and these are getting returned.What happened to the old days when hot rollers really were "hot"? Have they cheapened them so much to save money that they no longer work?These are definitely compact and a nice size for travel, but DON'T WASTE YOUR MONEY!
I love this leave- in condish. It makes my 3a/3b curls come to life and go all Shirley Temple. :-)

This is the best paddle brush I have found, and I looked at plenty before deciding on the Marilyn Flatter Me brush. The handle is rubber and provides a terrific grip. The brush is backed with a soft air formed pad which gives when you use it. It is a massage for your head and stimulating to your scalp. Very relaxing ! I also bought the Marilyn cleaning tool and it is super easy to keep my brush clean with that. The tortoise shell back is beautiful. This is a classic brush, I love it, and would recommend it to anyone !
Cool Water Deep by Davinoff bad quality, no the same as in the pass...old ? expired?

A good reason you should test make-up in person before ordering online: this stuff is pink. Like super pink. I already have a peaches-and-cream complexion so I didn't think it would be too pink for me but it is and it's expensive and now I'm stuck with it but it isn't the miracle product I expected from the gazillions of beauty editors who swear it's the holy grail of concealers. Lesson learned.

I bought this hair I was shocked when I got the hair because the color was really off I thought I ordered dark hair but it was kind of reddish or Oberon hope I spelled that right I have never tried color but took a chance it turned out okay but I think the color chart needs to be changed because the picture looks like dark hair and it was totally off wouldn't mind buying more but afraid that it will be the wrong color I did get it really fast so Thanks Amazon 3 stars are for color mistake

This Shower and Bath Gel, has been the one and only cleanser I have used since I was 16. (A long time ago) It will leave your skin so clean, soft and silky! No residue, no fuss, and I just love the fragrance. I bought the smaller size in the beginning, but now since I use it daily, I always order the Mega 40 oz. size. I have never been disappointed with Neutragena Rainbath.

I've been using Joico Daily Conditioning Shampoo (Kerapro), Joico Daily Care Balancing Conditioner (Lite), and Joico Daily Leave-In Detangler (Integrity) for over 20 years. It's hard to find hair care product with out Rosemary and Sage in them, which I'm allergic to. These products leave my very fine, thin hair soft and manageable.
It looks great on the wall, but just isn't very powerful. Takes much longer to dry my hair, wish I had known.
I bought this for my class reunion. I had many people comment on how fresh and light it smells. My husband loves it! It has become my "go to" fragrance.

VIvo en Venezuela, y aquí nadie vende productos Mustela, que considero lo más sofisticado en cosmetica para bebes y niños. Mi hijo usa toda la linea Mustela, desde Estelatopia hasta los protectores solares. El tratamiento con Hidrocortizona fué suspendido pués la aplicación de los productos Mustela hizo desaparecer magicamente todos los síntomas y signos de la dermatitis atópica. A todos los padres del mundo, por favor, solo usen esta marca de productos.

My hair is a bit coarse and definitely frizzy. It's wavy, too, though I wanted to smooth it out, and maybe straighten it. I like that, too. Velcro curlers can do either. For thicker, frizzy hair I think they're my head's best friend (next to conditioner <g>).
KISS MY FACE SOAP-excellant and so great for the whole body-during this long winter that we have hadthey should ship packaged together and not allowing it to toss in the box, as it chips the soap

This is the first alcohol-free toner I've ever tried. It smells much better than the alcoholic toner I was using. It's a little sticky though, which I guess is from the aloe. I don't really plan to buy it next time, but it's okay for the price.

I got this gel sometime ago and got around to using it for a wash-n-go. Just going to tell you all some pros/cons before buying it.PROS-Has a topical smell, so if you like that for you hair you'll def. enjoy it-Gives a lighter hold, soft actually-Dries clear-Not much shrinkage-Easy to rinse after usage-Defines the curl without it feeling crusty/hardCONS-After wearing my defined curls for a day and sleeping it the curls were less than defined-Gave my scalp an itchy feeling I did not appreciate-While applying it I noticed a sudsy appearance (I have dark hair, so if your hair is light you may notice it)-PARABEN ALERT!-Didn't lay down my edges had whip out my Eco Styler-6oz for $5 bucks where I can get a tub of Eco 32oz for this priceEnd result my hair had so-so results. It would probably be a good gel if you low on other styling products or wearing a style for a day/night out or til you get around to doing you hair.

my skin is oilier with this . I use maybe once a weekSince I can't return it . It leaves my skin smoothBut within an hour or so I touch my face andIt's all greasy. :-( I wish I could get my $$$ back.It was not worth what I paid.

This 'amazon' Body Kouros is totaly FAKE! After 15 minutes,his smell is off! I have original Body Kouros YSL, his smell is working two days on my skin! Very very bad business of 'amazon'! I want my money back!

...and yet, they are not. To be fair, I don't really have what would be considered thin lips, but they could use a slight pump. So, I use as directed; I promise. Here's what I get: glossy, wet, mildly burning lips with a sweet taste. Plump? Notsomuch. And the guy I kissed with LipFusion had an allergic reaction. Good thing I only kissed him on the lips...

I have been using Quorum as my cologne since 1972. Over the years I have noticed a slight change in the quality of the cologne, how long it lasts on the skin, etc. To me this last order (the bottle I have opened) is not very good. The perfumed aroma of Quorum is not there. I am going to do some skin and paper tests, and give them a smell. It seems to me, that if a cologne or perfume company changes their recipe on a product they should let the public know. Don't you think so?

i have used pureology styling lotion for 5 years and cant find a product to compare! i have coarse, dry, color treated, curly hair and alot of products are too creamy n dont have a firm enough hold so my hair just frizzes. It is somewhat sticky (I compare it to sticky water) but for me thats a good thing, provides better hold. However, you only need about a Quarter size amount for medium length hair otherwise you will have hard, crunchy spots. I comb mine through with my fingers rather than scrunch and works awesome!! cant say enough good stuff!
This product gave no clear way to determine the shade. When I ordered it I ordered the darkest shown and it stillwas too light.

This cologne is one of my go-to's. I use it off and on, and cycle with either this or Tommy Hilfiger for men.So, if I use it so often and recommend it, why the 3 stars?Because, as great as the scent is, it only lasts a few hours. I like a cologne scent to last a full 8-hour working day. This is nearly non-existent by lunch.But still, it's one of my favorite scents, and I spray it on twice a day (which means I run out twice as fast...Oh wow...maybe that's the marketing ploy all along.)If you're into a great, but not overbearing scent, give the dVb a try. It's wonderful and subtle. Just be prepared for it to wear off fairly shortly.

Before this , I was using a lightweight, nicely scented ROC facial lotion. I loved putting it on. I loved the light, silky feel and how it quickly absorbed. I loved the bottle it came in. It was small, nice and dispensed a good amount of lotion. It even had sunscreen in it! I decided to try something new and different (maybe better!) So I went with eb5. I think I regret this purchase. The cream is heavy, it doesn't absorb easily. It feels greasy and the jar method of using it can get messy. It doesn't have sunscreen. Well I can't return it because I used the piping method (like you do for decorating a cake) to try and shove this eb5 cream into the ROC bottle. Results were hilarious and overall successful, but it was a greasy mess. Next time I will probably get ROC again. I'm not a huge fan of this cream. It seems like when I wear it, my fiance sneezes a lot. We were in bed together and he got close to my face and started sneezing, complaining that it felt like a phantom traveled up his nose and behind his eyes (LoL). It started happening when I started using this cream. Oh well this forty dollar phantom is here to stay until I use up this overpriced cream. You live and learn.........

I have only used this product 3 times so far, and can already notice a change. My skin is very pale, so any flaws are very noticeable. I had begun getting some mild acne on my chin in the past year, that was leaving behind purple looking marks. This started to really bother me, so I researched possible solutions. I saw several reviews on MaMa lotion on various sites, so I decided to try it out. I admit that at first I was very nervous to put it on. My skin is pretty sensitive, and I was worried that flaking would make it worse. I do admit that it stings (very slightly) for a few seconds, but it is not bad. I am peeling a little bit, but a good moisturizer takes care of that during the day. The places where the skin has peeled off appear to be bright and healthy. The marks on my chin have gone from purple to a light pink. They seem to be fading fast. I am also hoping it will help smooth some of my fine lines, but I don't think I have used it enough yet to see a change in that. I also have freckles, and read that MaMa lotion can help fade those. After a few months of using this product I will come back and let you know!

I started using lip smackers as a kid, and went back to them recently. My lips were desperately dry and I had purchased a bunch for some goody bags for my nieces, and now I am attempting to un-do the damage. The product smells like gross fake strawberry, not the fresh strawberry scent that many body sprays, perfumes, and hair products contain. Additionally this does not hydrate well at all! It wears off with an hour, and makes my lips peal. This also has a shine, so it is really a lip gloss more than a lip moisturizer or chap stick.Perhaps this is just a fun little gift or novelty pretend make up item for little girls. I know I liked them as a kid, but as an adult it just doesn't cut it.

I bought this cologne after purchasing the aftershave. The aftershave smells distinctly masculine, but not overpoweringly so. With it fading fast, I thought to supplement it with the cologne. Unfortunately, the two do not smell the same. The cologne has a much lighter, citrus / floral scent, with the citrus being the dominant fragrance. It's not bad, and mixes well with the aftershave, which is itself a milder scent, but is more of a unisex fragrance.The bottom line; if you're looking for a copy of the aftershave, pass this one by. If however you're looking for a light, daytime scent that is clean and mild, give this a try as it won't break the bank.

Company shipped product fast. The hair is not real wavey when you wet it. I also tried to dye it a darker color and it did not take very well. Over all the price is good for the hair. I would not buy the hair if it was at its usual sell price. One plus its a 100% human hair, thats why I can understand why it wouldnt dye. Oh well I am happy with my braids :)

I will not be buying any more flat irons from Amazon. I bought 3 in a 1 month period. spent a total of 300 plus on them. The first one broke in 1 month, the 2nd in 2 weeks. This one did not work from the moment I took it out of the box. I felt so frustrated that I didn't even bother trying to return it, and the warranty is void because it's from amazon.
The ball mechanism does not turn easily and the glue hardly sticks. I found thois product disappointing and a waste of money.;

I have researched and reviewed loads of great stuff regarding this product. I have seen somewhat diminishing of the cellulite on my backside however but that was only when I was dieting and exercising consistently. Does anyone know if It will work on it's own?

This developer worked okay on my hair, but it didn't make all of my hair completely blonde. I used it with L'Oreal's Quick Blue bleach and left it on for almost two hours. It turned my roots yellow blonde and the rest of my hair a light orange color. I had hair that had been dyed black several times, so having dyed it as much as I did I think it worked fairly well. It mixed good with the Quick Blue into a creamy texture and it took most of the black color out, but if you have black hair and you want blonde hair (not an orange color), I would go with a 40 volume instead, just condition your hair extra to avoid damage.

Only half way through the bottle, I bought to help with keratosis pilaris and acne prevention can't say at this time if it's helped or not no significant difference. One thing I will say is this product smells like car wax or an automotive polish type product - to me anyway - so if your looking for something that has a sexy man scent this ain't it.
It smells really good, but doesn't last me all day. The smell fades fast. not sure if it's just this brand.
This is one of the best colognes for daytime use. I always get compliments from female co-workers.
This is just soap drizzled over synthetic flower petals. This product is way over priced! I gave $18.25 for this. I have never been so disappointed with a product sold on Amazon. Don't waste your $.

I have been using this product for several months now and have noticed fine hair is growing in the areas where I apply the product. I was hoping for fuller hair, but hopefully after several more months, it will be much more noticeable.
LOVE all of the AminoGenesis skin care products! Awesome cleanser . . . especially for very sensitive skin!

This is a great product - if you can get any on! The brush is too stiff and the product doesn't flow into the bristles easily. If you manage to apply the stain, it does last longer than ordinary lipstick. It is very dry, though. Don't think I'll buy again.
Love the color, but it dries matte. It's not a matte polish. So I don't know what is wrong with that.
excellent product..However, Amazon was extremely slow processing and shipping my order..I am not sure I want to order from Amazon again....!!!
I origally bought this cologne for my husband in a smaller size to see if I liked it and it smelled so good that I bought him the 3.4 ounce bottle. He loves it and so do I.

My 4 year old had flat warts on her chin. Dermatologists suggested strong systemic medications as well as retin-a. It occurred to me that witch hazel sloughs of dead skin cells just like retin-a does, so I thought I would give this a try instead. Her warts are gone! Plus, I use it to clear up my own blemishes. Dickinson's works better than any witch hazel I have ever tried. Well worth the price...

I've been using Philosophy products for a while. I'm 31 and have dry skin and the "hope" series works great for me (Purity made simple, when hope is not enough, hope in a jar and hope in a tub). The Peel Pads feel great when you are applying it, refreshing and clean sensation, no burning like other pads I've tried. But I notices that after a few hours my skin gets a little oily, which didn't happen before I started using the pads. The pads are a little thinner than what I was expecting but it isn't a problem for me. I believe the product is a good one, but just not right for my type of skin.

I have very, very oily skin, and although this product is not specified for oily skin, it is extremely effective for removing excess oil and cleaning out my pores. Other products I've tried specifically formulated for oily skin tend to be overly drying and irritate my skin. This product doesn't irritate my skin at all. It's so gentle, I can't believe it's as effective as it is. It also leaves my skin squeaky clean and petal soft. Plus its full of wonderful botanicals. It's definately one of the best face washes on the market under 10 bucks.
Smells really good, i really like it, i could say have a citric notes, and make you feel fresh all day. Excellent.
I wish it came in a larger size but the product itself is great. I use it on my stretch marks

There is a significant musk smell, but the lotion works great. Should be aware if you are allergic to Musk fragrance/natural odors? from the lotion... Great repair for skin. But if allergic to musk, be aware.
This is used by many plastic and cosmetic surgeons to aid in germ warfare prior to surgery.

As a turquoise fanatic and nail polish enthusiast, I had to purchase this.Pros:-Only two coats needed-Bright color-Dries insanely fastCons:-Appears to be flat, no shimmer /gloss to it and thus a top coat of clear is needed. Some girls choose to skip this step but you can't really do that with this one.-The turquoise ended up being a teel that leans very green. This wasn't what I was looking for at all.-Thin polish that chips easily, another reason to need a top coat of clear.

How firm a foundation? The answer in regard to this pancake makeup is too firm.It reminds me of the makeup, although I can't remember the brand, that we used in our local little theaater group. But, these people were going on stage.However, if it's really thorough coverage that you want this may be the product for you. Just be sure you don't leave any "embarkation lines" around chin or ears.

I like the lotion itself but it's really too smelly. Someone really nice on eBay sent me samples of all the scents and they're all just too much. I went back to Burt's Bees and gave this to my daughter.
I was hoping for a soft scent. This is really STRONG! You can use it as a room deodorizer while still wrapped! This brand is terrific soap though and I love the mild honeysuckle one!
The perfum smells delicious, and the presentation of the product is nice,but the aroma lasts only a short time, and this is a very importantvalue in an eau the toilette, one expects to last longer.

I was diagnosed with an auto-immune disease 12 years ago, one year later I had to have a full hysterectomy. Between these two conditions, and having to take steroids in addition to the hormones and too many other drugs, I was miserable and had pretty much given up being able to wear makeup. Other than mascara and a little lip color/gloss, everything just sweated right off. The auto-immune disease has affected my skin in a few spots, two on my face and one on my neck, plus some on my arms. One on my forehead and the one on my neck are quite noticable. Depressing, to say the least. Cover-up-type makeup was way too heavy and looked just awful. But ERA (I bought the primer and the foundation) is a God send. As soon as I got it I actually sprayed it at my face, but it got everywhere all in my hair, and made it stiff like hairspray. I'm not supposed to actually use sprays of any kind so that was kind of stupid of me, anyway. So I read the instructions (!) and used a natural sponge, and it is light and sheer but covers and blends beautifully. It stays on and lasts. I feel like I look pretty again.

I've always been a fan of this hair mask but unfortunately I had to give it 1 star since the jar I got in the mail is either fake or defective. The stuff made my hair really really dry and tangled. I noticed right away because everytime after I put this hair mask on, I always touched my ends and they felt really soft and smooth; this time however they dont. I am returning this jar and probably wont never buy it from Amazon! BEWARE

I am an African American woman. This is the first heat protectant I've used. I used it before blow-drying and was happy with the way it left my hair soft. The problem didn't come until I used it before pressing my hair. IT BURNED MY HAIR OFF! I was so mad I took it back. After discussing what happen to my aunt whose a beautician, I discovered that because the spray left my hair wet it burned off from my heat appliant. She said heat protectants are meant to work with blow-dryers and no more is needed for additional heat. I give it three stars for instructing to use on dry hair before applying heat. Besides that, its a good product.
This soap makes our skin feel very soft and it has no harmful chemicals. Rated one of the best soaps for you on www.ewg.org under skin deep database.

My children have eczema so I cannot bathe them everyday, so this is a great alternative. I have noticed you have to use a lot to get a good lather and then towel dry hair well to get food, etc out of my children's hair, but this product has been great. Leaves both kids hair clean and shiny.

The polish is good quality, goes on just as smooth as OPI. The color is not as bright as it seems in photos- it faded and turned slightly more green after a day of wear. It's a cute polish but I wish it was more true to the actual Tiffany blue color. I use it mostly as an accent color when making nail designs and it looks really nice. If you paint all your nails just that color, the fading looks strange and unflattering, though.

This shower gel has a slightly-citrus tang and foams up well in normal water, which means it'll last you a while since not much is needed for one use. I'm not sure what the "snake peel" (or, even more interesting, the "desert minerals") are intended to be, but they seem to clean very well, and they did so without drying my skin. This gel comes with blue, exfoliating micro-beads, but there are so few of them that their effect appears to be negligible, as is the after-scent of this so-so shower scrub.

Everywhere I go I have somebody complimenting my nails, and asking me about them, telling me how much they like them. It's a must have for any nail polish collection, I'm going to be purchasing the shatter in silver ASAP so I can wear it with dark shades too! Best part? even if you have trouble with the painting your right hand, it doesn't matter with this stuff because it's not supposed to be perfect, and touch ups are hardly noticeable!**UPDATE** 12/31/11For some reason the polish is all goopey and gross already. It is very difficult to use, and I'm not really happy about it... don't really understand what happened...**UPDATE** 2/11/12It's so thick and goopey that It's completely un-usable. even if i am able to get it smoothly across my nail, it no longer will "evaporate" (or however it works to create the "shattered" look). I'm really disappointed.

My son loves this colgne and every year i get o line and order however this year it was so hard to find and so expensive. When i did order this it did not get here by christmas and it was so small i just laughed. If i had realized how small it was i would have never bought this

SO I haven't used it yet but I was pretty angry to realize that I paid double the price. I had no idea where to look for this dryer and of course my always trusting amazon had it but when I went to Target I saw it for 19.99. I am a little upset, probably fair game but nonetheless sad.

I don't love the scent, it has a chemical smell that remains and seems stronger to me than the gardenia scent. I think it was expensive for the size and I will just stick with using organic coconut oil from now on.

I love it, it feels good when I use it, after using it my skin feels so smooth and soft. only problem I have with this product is I can't seem to find the replacement dove wipes in the store. I have been to several different stores and still have not found them. I guess I will have to find them online.

I have been using this for a month. It works amazingly on dry (or a little moist) hair. I did try on my hair (medium length and thickness) when wet (without blow drying; i.e. just towel dry hair)but it did not work. It took me quite long, however the end results were not even near perfect. However I'll refer this as worth the price, if you are looking for a normal hair straighter with no magical powers.

I wanted to like this acne treatment system, as it had a lot of features going for it:- I like the 3 step system.--- Step 1 is washing with the cleanser (used like soap) to remove oil and dirt--- Step 2 is called the "Calming Toner" is wiped on with cotton or a cosmetic pad and provides further cleaning of pores while at the same time soothing the skin--- Step 3 is a cream that is absorbed into the skin to kill acne causing bacteria, but also provide moisture.- The ingredients seem high quality.- The components each behave well when applied: The Cleanser washes off easily, the Toner absorbs/evaporates quickly, and the cream absorbs readily.- I like the scents: Pleasantly floral, but not too feminine.The instructions include the warning that you may need to "ease into" using the cream as it may cause dry skin. I did find that I experienceds some irritation when using the cream, but it was only brief and did not ultimately seem to dry out my skin.So why only 3 stars? Well for all its benefits, it did not seem to adequately control break-outs for me. I do not have a serious acne problem, but rather suffer from occasional blemishes . After using this system for a week I did not see any diminishment in the frequency or severity of these break-outs. I may actually have noticed an increase in frequency, which I think may be attributable to the cream (step 3) which although moisturizing may also be clogging my pores. I will continue to try the system with only steps 1 and 2.In conclusion I think this is a high quality system, but it did not work for me. Everyone's skin and reactions are different though, so if you are willing to give it a try it may be worth it.

This is the cologne that my husband wears and I love it. It is nice to be able to purchase at a much lower price. I bought two bottles for the price I would generally pay for one at the department store.

I love this product! Anytime one changes a cleansing product, you have to go through an adjustment period. I found that during no period that I utilized the replacement product for men... My skin did not react well or adjust. Now, I have nearly twenty packages in my cabinet. I hope that they continue to provide this product.

Very beautiful nail polish, but it chips easily so I'd suggest applying at least 3 coats. Another drawback is that it is a pain to get off since it's glitter nail polish. Might have to soak nails in acetone for easier removal. Other than that, very good product.
The colors of these pencils are very pretty but they are very hard to apply. You have to press hard on your eyelid to get the color on. Also, they really pull on the eyelid. I won't re-order.
This is my favorite perfume, however I never received it in the mail. I wish I did.

I used to wear this cologne in my early 20s. Since then my taste has changed and I prefer Chanel Egoiste Platinum. I thought I'll wear Cigar again. I still liked the smell, but my wife thought it made me smell like an old guy, so I stopped using it.

I purchased Zoya polishes in two shades, Tart (blue) and Lana (pinkish orange-red), and have had to repolish multiple times over the last three weeks. The colors are beautiful; they catch light very easily, which adds just a hint of sparkle. But without a base coat, they go on thin and streaky, requiring 2-3 coats for solid, non-transparent color. I've also had problems getting the layers to dry; even waiting 10-15 minutes between coats doesn't keep the polish from scratching easily even 24hrs later (it doesn't chip, it slides off). I added a base coat and a hardening top coat, which cut down on the need for multiple coats for full coverage, but as I'm a rather impatient girl, I haven't found the magic time length that will make these polishes set. For comparison sake, I usually use OPI, Essie, or L'Orėal polishes, and while they sometimes chip, I've never had the same issues with drying time or polish smudging.

While the blending of orange blossom and jasmine is luscious, this fragrance is a bit heavy for me. Perhaps I erred in buying the eau de parfum and should have purchased the eau de toilette. I've read that about three-fourths of eau de parfum is lost after several hours. That's not been my experience with Carolina Herrera. In fact, the aroma is still in the crook of my elbows until I wash it off, and it's as if I had just applied it. For many that may be a major attribute.However, my preference is for a much lighter scent - sort of a "barely there." While this fragrance is lovely, I wouldn't recommend wearing it to a concert or any place where you'll be in close quarters with others who may not want to enjoy your wonderful aroma.If your plans are for an evening in some secluded spot with a special someone - enjoy!

I bought it to dry my hair while I applied make-up, kill two birds with one stone, but my hair is still wet and requires a regular blow dryer. It does speed up the regular drying but not as much as I hoped. If you have hair of any length and expect this to dry your hair completly, you better have an hour.

This works really well. It is not time-consuming, it's easy, and it works sooo great. It leaves your hair really soft and silky and hydrated than it ever would be. It is a little pricey, but on Amazon it is way cheaper than in Target, and the product seems to be authentic.ONE THING. It smell so, so strong. Looking at the outside of this product, it seems so natural and mild. But the scent it so strong i can smell it even when the jar is closed... Now, I am a very sensitive girl when it comes to scents, but the smell is strong even for someone not as sensitive as I am.It smells like a lot of chemicals.. not natural at all, not fresh, and it's kind of weird. Totally unpleasant. It smells like it tried TOO hard to smell good and then failed.I'm so glad i bought 8.5 oz instead of 16 oz, because that would have been a lot of money wasted.I wanted to love this so much, but turns out that I don't.

Where was this item in the 60's when I really could have used it instead of rollers? If you have naturally curly hair, and you like the smoother looks, this hot air brush is for you! Great price, and the ONLY place I can find it is on Amazon! I couldn't live without it!

It really does the job taking of makeup, amazingly well. I've used it on everything from long wearing foundation to mascara to gel liner and paint pots and it makes pretty darn short work of them all. It may need a lil work on water proof mascara. The only negative is that where the consistency is almost exactly like water, you do need to be careful not to totally soak your cotton pad when you're taking your eye makeup off, or when you press it onto your eye, you'll get the product in your eye- it may hurt a bit if it goes in your eye. While it isn't in the cheapest range, you will get your money's worth. A little goes a long way and it's actually an amazing product. I have sensitive skin and it doesn't irritate my skin at all.

I cannot believe I got scammed so bad, thank God I didn't pay the original price. This not what Celine Dion smells like! I got this same perfume about 3 months ago at [...] and I fell in love with it, so I decided to get a bigger bottle from this site worse mistake ever. The perfume smelled like it went bad (which I don't think is possible) this perfume has a naturally soft smell below is the product description: "Celine Dion Perfume contains an inspiring blend of light luscious floral including water lily orange blossom and exotic tiare flower balanced with warm rich amber sheer musk and pristine blonde woods the result is a scent that's perfect for every day yet still sophisticated enough for special occasions. Notes include Red Berry Dew Heliotrope Italian Bergamot Lily of the Valley Cyclamen Mist Violets Yellow Rose Osmanthus Tiare Flower Accord Orange Blossom Jasmine Muguet Blonde Woods Sandalwood Warm Amber Sheer Musk".That junk smells nothing like the above description; it smells like it went bad. I don't know if perfume can expire (which I doubt) but this one might have. It's as if they mixed with 55% PISS and 45% what was suppose to Celine Dion original scent. They didn't even send it in the original perfume box; I just got it in a brown box with bubble wrap. I know it's a test product, but there's no reason why it should smell like it is still being tested for sale approval. Please keep in mind that the real Celine Dion smells really GOOD, but this version is not the real thing or maybe just the one I got.

I don't know ladies....I wish that I found this site and your comments PRIOR to watching last weekend's BE Anniversary program on a television shopping program which shall remain nameless.After experiencing the dreadfull after effects from a Thyroid condition and its removal - my once lovely, even, oft-complimented beauty queen skin is ravaged. I can hardly think about leaving my home, whereas "once upon a time" I could hardly be found I was so out and about town. I hate to even go outside and garden because even my normally polite neighbors have lost their graciousness by looking at me and remarking "what happened to your face?".Normally when I needed "foundation", I used Fashion Fair's pressed powder for oily skin (Walnut/Pecan depending on the season). For those of us with deeper pigment, you know what I am talking about. This product worked for more than 5 years to combat the various remnants of a breakout. I could still see my skin under the product, but a dab directly on the "remnant" would do just fine.I had heard about BE via its infamous infomercials- never bothering to watch all the way thru because it felt like a gimmick and I neeeever really saw anyone with a darker hue on the program. This past weekend - I thought it was a Que from the universe that I accidentally caught the Anniversary Sale program. The colors and demonstrations were wonderful and better than the infomercial in that they actually used two(2) models of Colour. I should have listened to my inner voice when I had to call and ask...."when the Models used for a particular product are all Caucasian models...should I take that to mean that the product being shown is primarily for those of European descent?... I was told that BE was for all Skin tones. Being in my early 40's...I should not have fallen for the oky-doke...but I did. I was...am desperate to feel better.I ordered the tinted Mineral veil, the Honey Bisque( both have come with brushes) and I am now waiting for the Latte Buzz Collection (Warmth, Glee and Radiance). Of course now confusion sets in...should I have ordered the Warmth Radiance? Is the Radiance, True, Clear or Warmth? I did not order the Foundation. The colors offered did not seem true even on the program (nor were the two newest darker colors offered)- - however, this weekend I am heading to Sephora to get samples of Deep, Dark, Deepest Deep and a 4th kind of dark (I think).I have worked for the last 2 days with the Veil and Bisque and together I look like the Last Black Deadish Morticia. It did not get any better even after I applied the FF (with a brush)over it to get some "color" back. That "glowy" sheen that everyone is talking about is underneath doing something...I can't put my finger on it. It is quite peculiar and not in a good way.Yes, everything is lite as a feather. I do not feel "mask-like"...but admittedly it is not doing anything but highliting my "issues".I will continue to try to work with this product (after all it has only been 2 days - - but nothing else has taken 2 days for me to become satisfied or decide whether or not it was for me) and get samples before I spend anymore big bucks on this product. I am really hoping it will work, given some time. Thankfully the shopping program has a 30 day money back guarantee.Thank you all for your honesty and I'll let you know!

I have been using Bare Minerals in Fairly Light for three years, and while it is better overall than any liquid foundation on the market for sensitive skin, it's not great. This powder highlights the dry areas of my skin and does not hold up well against midday shine on my T-zone. Also, I think I may be slightly allergic/sensitive to mica, because my face feels a little itchy right after applying. I've only continued using it because I have been unable to find something better.Until now, that is. Meow Cosmetics is a small internet-based brand, they have 3 coverage formulations and over 80 shade choices, and you get three times the amount of product for the same price as Bare Minerals. I find that their formulation is gentler on my skin and offers better coverage, and I will be switching brands as soon as I finish off my last jar of Bare Minerals.

LOVE this stuff. I have a lot of hair but it is very fine and really long so the weight of my hair pulls down any body I would have making my hair look limp. I've also had a baby recently and all my hair is falling out!! However, after about 5 squirts of the BB Thickening Spray, I have fuller, bouncier hair and who doesn't want that?! I spray it on my freshly clean hair when it is wet, then flip my head over and blow dry. I have coupled the spray with BB Straightening gel because my hair can get weird and wavy in moisture. The end result is clean feeling, soft, full hair. I have noticed that if I get a little over excited and spray too much of the spray it will make my hair feel a bit more tacky than I like. So I would say you have to experiment with the amount that will work for you.

While in my teens I used Mane n' Tail products religiously. Back then, I felt their product line was the only thing on the market built to deal with my semi-coarse curly/ kinky hair. I come from a line of "mixed" type hair (half black half white), and tho my hair is not too coarse, it is very curly and dried easily. In addition, I might add that I live in a desert, so high moisture/ intense hydration products are a must.Mane n' Tale as a whole is a decent product line, but now that I'm an adult and have more knowledge and awareness about chemicals and alcohol use in products, I no longer feel their line is for me.I purchased this leave-in on a whim. I was looking for a product that would hold my daughter and I off until I had the time to do some homework on leave-ins.As a leave-in, this product is OK. The spray cap mists onto hair and provides a wide area of coverage, and the spray itself has a decent smell, but overall, this product (like many others) merely provides the illusion of moisture. A few minutes after application, both my hair and my daughters felt dry yet gooey to the touch. This is the same problem I experienced with the Giovanni 'Organic' leave-in conditioner. These products are made by carriers who mass produce, so in efforts to spread their product so costs are efficient for both them and the customer, some quality is lost along the way. In the case of some of these leave-ins, they usually carry a blend of ingredients that promotes a sort of illusory moisture, meaning it feels okay at first, but once the chemicals dry you may experience an adverse effect. After some research, the best explanation for this I can give is that these products are more focused on instant gratification than long-term sustainability. Products like this are great at first, then after a year or so of use, suddenly your hair is falling out, or its a lot dryer than usual and you don't know how to correct the issue because the last thing you'd expect is your leave-in, but sure enough it's the little things that can cause the most damage.A true fix: I've found that a true fix to dry hair is first and foremost to take care of yourself from the inside out... (Green juices, more iron in your diet, and lost and LOTS of water). Second, keep your hair PH balanced, especially while shampooing or while using a leave-in. If you need to educate yourself on how PH balancing works with your hair, please go to youtube and watch videos by kimmaytube. You can type "Kimmaytube ph balance" in the search. Balancing your hair and keeping it alcohol free is essential to hair health, and acidifying your hair is necessary for maintenance, shine and moisture sealing.As much as I respect American business, so long as these over-the-counter leave-ins try to combine herbal ingredients with chemicals, they will never grant true health or repair to human hair. Hair is an organic extension of the human body, so the products we use should be minimal, clean, and their richness should depend on the texture of your hair and the humidity in your environment. My recommendations would be Shea hair moisture cream products mixed with Aloe Vera gel and either Jojoba oil or Castor oil(40/40/20 blend).

I had ordered through Amazon the item named "Buf-Puf Double-Sided Body Sponge-1 ea." through Amazon. This was the same item I had previously ordered which came in a green box. Unfortunately, there is another "Buf-Puf Double-Sided Body Sponge-1 ea." which comes in a white and gold box, and is somewhat rougher to the skin touch than that which is in the green. There is otherwise no way to tell the difference in these two products by their packaging description, nor any other that I can determine. Again, unfortunately, this supplier did not distinguish the two items, and sent the product in the White and Gold box instead. (I had ordered two of each, for my own comparison test; both suppliers--there is a different supplier for each product--sent the same white and gold box. Therefore my "scientific" test is shot.)All this preface to tell you that the Buf-Puf is the best bathing appliance since soap, in my opinion. It provides enough abrasion to feel as if you've removed all the body oils and dirt, as well as leaving the skin "tingly". Although I've tried both the rough and smooth sides (the blue and the white sides), I can tell no difference in the feel of the skin afterwards. I suppose women with their softer skin could notice a difference on elbows, knees, and feet; I just could not.In essence, this product is heads and shoulders above a simple washcloth; If I didn't have a Buf-Puf, I'd forego bathing. (Hmmm, maybe that's why I was avoided while awaiting their delivery.)

To say that this is a "bad" mascara would be very untrue. However, because we all have differences in personal style, this mascara is incapable of making every single person who tries it out 100% happy. To me, it is just okay, but to someone who is my complete opposite on the style scale, this may be your favorite mascara. When it comes to my eye makeup, I usually prefer earthy, neutral eyeshadow paired with a very dramatic lash. I like lashes that are long, dark, and voluminous--borderlining on falsies, but not quite there. Maybelline Full 'N Soft just doesn't do that for me. In my opinion, this mascara is for women (or men--hey, I don't discriminate) who would like to look casual during business hours or for teens who are new to makeup and going for a natural look. As far as Maybelline's promise of fuller, softer, healthier, clump-free lashes; I would say that they get a 3/4 rating. While traditional mascaras make your lashes brittle and prone to flaking by the end of the day, Full 'N Soft made my lashes feel as if I weren't wearing any makeup at all--which may be part of the problem, depending on how you look at the situation. When I removed Full N'Soft, my lashes felt healthier than they normally would bare. Also, the mascara delivers on its promise of being clump-free. In a(n)(unsuccessful) attempt to create my more dramatic look, I applied no less than five good coats of this product. While I was silently hoping for at least a little clumpiness to bring the illusion of fullness, this mascara stubbornly refused to tack up on my lashes. Once again, you decide whether that is a positive or negative quality. But when it comes to "full", Maybelline Full 'N Soft just did not deliver to me. My lashes were only minimally more voluminous than when I first put on the mascara (I have moderately thin lashes), and it took 3+ coats to make me look and feel as if I were wearing any makeup at all. So for those of you who want only the most natural enhancement of your lashes to get you through the work day or through your first day of high school, I recommend this mascara. But for those of you (like me) who want lashes that would make even the most draggy of drag queens green with envy, I suggest you better listen to your mama and shop around.

Not too sure about this product. The first time I didnt notice any changes really, mayeb cuzz I didnt use enough so the next time I had used ALOT, I did notice slight changes but nothing dramatic.

I wasnt expecting this scent to smell the way it does, I bought it blindly just based on the reviews and because the price was pretty good, it smells like alcohol at first, but after i let it sit for like a week, i went back to smell it and it smelled good. I wore it to work one morning and i didnt get a reaction of how good i smell like i usually do when i wear my burberry brit or hot water, but later in the day a couple ladies said i smelled pleasant. So its not to shabby i guess. Nothing i would bend over backwards to get though.

I made the mistake of ordering it on ebay, it broke after 3 months, and because ebay was not one of the authorized resellers therefore had no warranty. But if I was sure it was an excellent iron, for this reason I ordered it from Folica via Amazon. I love it! leaves my hair ultra smooth and extremely shiny. I go the gym everyday at noon and go right back to work afterwards, and this iron has proven to not burn my hair with everyday use. It is light weight, with adjustable temperatures and perfect for my long hair, which is very dry and kinda frizzy. A friend of mine was using a different brand, which was good, but she had been thinking about buying a wider one of the same brand. I let her try mine and he loved it! she order it the next day. I really recommend it with my eyes closed.

This cologne isnt very musky like men's aftershave type fragrances but rather is very sweet and feminine(could easily be a women's perfume). I think its VERY strong and smells best lingering on your clothes than full force and freshly sprayed(in which its annoying like old church lady perfume). Women tend to like this smell but not in the way men want women to like it(older women like it alot). Like I said, lingering on the clothes it smells a bit different(more youthfully masculine and fun)...I personally use this cologne on weekends when I only plan on going to a few stores or working out. I dont regret buying it...it was fairly inexpensive and they give you ALOT. I recommend this for older men who want to smell youthful while attracting older women OR to teen boys who enjoy smelling more sweet like roses than musky like men's aftershave. It seems weird to smell this on all other age groups(including myself...im 25 and I feel weird as the smell doesnt match my style but oh well, weird is ok sometimes).
Great perfume. Love the smell. Long lasting. Amzaon shipped it extremely fast. And got it for an amazing price. Love it.

Moisturel is an excellent product. I've used it for years. But this seller(Unique sports accessories-) is too high priced on shipping. In future I will place all Moisturel orders with DERMAdoctor which gives better faster service and lower shipping.

The product and price were excellent; however, all three bottles arrived open with part of their contents spilled. I believe the seller has had this problem before because they were shipped inside a zip-lock bag. I lost maybe an inch of product out of two of the bottles and one of the bottles lost only 1/2 inch. Due to the great price, I wasn't too concerned about the amount lost; however, it was a major mess and I had to clean everything up prior to storing and use. The seller should review their packaging to ensure that liquids can safely make it to their destinations. There was only one pillow pack in the package, allowing the contents room to move around. The reduction in stars is not related to the product, but rather the purchase experience.
i have been using these for 3 months now, religiously applying twice a day and it doesnt work. cheap but wont help.

This has been my absolute favorite perfume since it came out in 1969 and it is increasingly hard to find. Very unusual, light, fresh fragrance - floral, but with a warm note. This is NOT a strong perfume in any of its strengths, so it is impossible to overpower wearing this scent. I wish it lasted a little longer, but it may on different people.It seems so many fragrances from the same maker smell the same these days. This one is decidedly different and a real treasure, in my opinion. If you hate Shalimar (I do) you will be pleasantly surprised by this scent.

I love the color of this polish. It's bright and unique and complimentary to most skin tones [I would imagine]. However, the texture of it sucks. It has glitter, and it makes it really hard to apply smoothly and evenly. It's pretty thick. Getting it off is impossible, you have to use 100% acetone. With that being said, it doesn't really chip easily and stays on well.

Review from a person with skin type: Normal.HEY!!!Have you ever HATED a product sooooooooo much that you just HAD to track it down to write a POOR review? Well this is my first time going out of my way to track down a product just to write a review on it.I purchased this product almost a year ago at a spa in my area, depasquale spa to be specific. I read foaming cleansing gel and paid twenty eight bucks for a darn face cleanser ( yes I know, what was I thinking...well I thought expensive = good at that time) and got home used it and hated it SO MUCH!!!!It's like taking a punch from someone and not being able to do crap about it, writing this review makes me feel a bit better though.So first of all the product does not even foam as name suggested. I had to use like 3 - 4 pumps of the product to feel like there was some sort of soap on my face ( and no my face is not big)... I usually use one pump of a face soap cleanser NOT 4 pumps..... and did the product even make a lather???? NOOOOOOOOOO!!! No lather, no soap suds, no foam NOTHING and it sucks at removing makeup also. I do not wear makeup often but I have also tried washing my make up off my face using this and it did a poor job so I had to use another cleanser.I cannot express to you how much I HATE this product. This is by faaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaar the WORST cleanser I have ever laid hands on...If this was a seven dollar cleanser I would still HATE it but paying almost thirty buck for this just makes me feel even worse.Crap crap crap crap CRAP!!!!!I HIGHLY DO NOT RECOMMEND!!!!!!!!!!! UGGGGGGGGGGGGGGGGGGGGGGGGGGGGGGGGGH!!!!

this order arrived quickly. it was packaged to avoid breakage. included in the package was a recycle bag that can be used for purchases such as groceries. also, included was a sample bottle of Good to Go by essie. i will definitely order from this vendor again.

This is an old scent. I remember this when I was in college back in 1988 and a class mate had this on and I was transfixed on the beautiful smell coming from her. This is a crisp clean scent, I would put this in the green catagory of scents. I perfer the Eternity Summer to this but only because its sweeter and I tend to lean toward sweet scents. This however is a very pleasant scent but my nose has become overwhelmed with this scent for over twenty years now and can tolorate it no more. Its a pleasent scent but quite old in terms of scent life for a marketed perfume.

I have smelled this in the department store and it didn't smell like the one Amazon sent me. I know my fragrances, this is supposed to smell very much like Acqua Di Gio, and it smells nothing like it. I didn't wanna write a bad review but I saw a recent review that says it's good obviously from somebody who doesn't know about the true greatness of this cologne. I felt like I should leave a review because there's may mislead people. The only good thing about Amazon is that they refunded me. Amazon has the best customer service ever, but if you're looking for Just Me, I wouldn't order it here unless you want a stale, expired cologne with very short longevity.

I have very sensitive skin and am prone to eczema...I use Aubrey products and especially this soap...I pour this into a 2x size container with a pump and fill the remaining space in the container with distilled water. I prefer the consistency and have a nice 32oz. supply. It works very well, thoroughly cleans the skin and leaves no residues. Never drying

The most negative reveiws on this product were right. The brush was NOT soft at all and it was a painful experience to use it for the first time. Then the handle and brush fell apart after the initial use. What a piece of junk!!! Amazon, where is your quality product review/control department? My first product review ever at Amazon because I was never this mad and I was embarrassed to be so stupid to buy this product. It is in my trash bin now and it is not worthy to return it.
I am a fan of NARS creme eye shadow and am a bit disappointed with the powder version. Color is fine, nice neutral, everyday color but I need to wear eyeshadow base to make it work.
The fragrance of this product is not even remotely anything like lavender. It was difficult to use,as it arrived caked solid, not in pellets as pictured.
Average nothing to write home about. Does not really seal anything. I was looking for something to protect from continuous hand washing.
I ordered the original scented body oil and received the sesame formula. I was really disappointed. But now that I have used the oil, I like it too.

I love this. I received it as a gift for Christmas & I wear it daily! I always get complimented on this scent. It is "ME". I can't say enough good things about it. I plan on purchasing more soon because I am running low. I have not had a signature scent in years. I am so glad I was given this.

I love this product. I blew out my last one and couldn't find it in local stores. Ended up buying two similar type stylers and hated them. I was thrilled to find this product still available online. I have wavy and frizzy hair and no other styler offers the kind of gentle smoothing and frizz control as this one. Because you can also use it on dry hair, if I'm caught in a drizzle and end up with frizz, I can touch it up in a hurry and look 'salon ready' for anything later in my day.Should add that the product life was likely shortened because I used it in Europe for 6 months and even with a converter, I think the unit got zapped.
The Clove Mint Zum bar is my favorite of the soaps! The scent is so gorgeous and soothing..and the lather feels like silk ... you come out of the shower so relaxed and moisturized. I love it!
I bought this for a Christmas gift for my husband mainly because it was described as having an alarm but it DOES NOT have an alarm.
my female friend loves this scent..however way too feminine and sweet smelling for a man to wear..U can smell a hint of gin and tonic but the flowery scents overpower this.

I recently purchased a Ouidad package. When it came in the mail, the conditioner had spilled out all over everything. I emailed the customer service staff and they responded it was the fault of UPS. Okay, well that could be the case IF the package was dented in any way. It was not, so I told them the conditioner must have left their facility with a loose top. They denied it, and were rude. Needless to say, I did not get to try the products yet, but regardless, I won't be ordering from them again. A customer should at the very least, leave satisfied, if not happy. I was neither.
Wish I had read previous comment. They again have sent the wrong thing. I suggest you do not order from them if you actually want this product.
Its not the same as it used to be it didn't cover the same and was a bit disappointed that it wasn't nearly as light as I hoped.

What I wanted was not what i received. They tricked me into ordering what i could have purchased right around the corner. The white labeled bottle that they are showing here is not what i received. The white labeled bottle is the older product thats hard to find and it is much, much better than the new gold labeled bottle that is supposedly the exact same formula or new and improved but it is not. The product I received from here is sold at every sallys hair supply store on the planet at a lower cost than what it is sold for here. I feel raped. and I believe the people selling this knows this. otherwise why are you showing the white labeled bottle and sending the gold labeled bottle. I would like my money back or the correct product because this is some BULL!!

My hair is so awful. Half curly, half straight, fine but tons of it. I have to tried so many different leave ins, smoothers and serums so that I can style it to look decent. This is the only product I have ever used that makes each hair shaft respond to heat styling.It's not stiff, it's not just a 'softener' so that it's soft but won't hold a style... it's just perfect. Doesn't weigh my hair down and styles instantly - no fighting. My hair is in long-ish layers and I like to style it kinda fluffy - this stuff is exactly what I've been looking for.
Pro: Retractable cord and folding handle are very convenient and easy to store. Not too noisy.Con: Actual product looks bigger than what I expected.
Goodhouskeeping recommended this product. They said it really took away fine lines, etc. I bought the product. It has a very nice texture and feels good, but there was no reduction in fine lines.

Curly girls rejoice! Use this product on wet hair and let dry naturally.... NO FRIZZ, it WORKS!!!Highly reccomend, I have baby fine wavy hair(very prone to frizz)this just lets the hair curl and wave with shine and no crunch!!expensive, but worth it, worth it.

This heated eyelash curler was recommended by a friend. I've tried it a couple of times and still need to practice. One of the suggestions that I read that has worked for me is to apply some mascara FIRST and then use the curler.

This is a usual acne treatment , I purchased this as it said it was a scar treatment. Most acne solutions work differently for different people , having understood that , this cream is a salicyclic acid treatment and focuses only on ACNE and not on SCAR

I had a horrible reaction to the NEW formula. Burning, redness, hot skin like a bad sunburn. Went away after a few hours but was quite painful. Used this lotion for years and had no problem. Wondering what went into the new formula that might have caused this. Has anyone else had similar experiences?

I am so disappointed in this product. It is not the Biosilk serum I buy at the stores. It's completely watered down and has way too much alcohol. What you can find at the stores feels different and stays on your hair. This feels like a nail polish remover.

I know Midnight Cowboy is one of Urban Decay's most popular colors, but I can not figure out why. This shade has way too much glitter in it. It doesn't stay put, even with the primer potion. It gets absolutely everywhere besides your eyelid. It gets on your cheeks, your hands, and even in your eyes. When you look at the eyeshadow, it has a nice champagne color. However, the color doesn't show up on your skin, only the excessive glitter does. I highly suggest using Urban Decay's matte eyeshadows instead. They work much better without the trashy glitter.

This makeup does not offer a lot of coverage. put too much on and its EXTREMELY visible and looks cakey. Does brighten skin up, however, if you have naturally clear skin. Should not be used with dry skin because it will enhance this even if you moisturize
This color is absolutely eye-catching. I love how unique it looks and how it catches everyone's eye. This polish applies shiny then dries matte for a very unique look.

This hand creme smells great and really leaves your skin very soft. I first used it at my mother-in-laws and fell in love with it instantly, so much so I bought 4 of them. I would recommend this to everyone, but you do have to like the Pomegranate scent.

Or does this perfume smell like mouthwash? Somebody actually gave this to me for my birthday. I couldn't believe it. Anyway, mouthwash doesn't smell bad, but still. I was expecting maybe a light floral scent. I'll probably give this away to one of my younger cousins.

This product is great. I've been having some problems finding stuff like this where I live, when they were always readily available before. I've been using it for several weeks, and I have to say it leaves hair very soft and shiny. Hair has stopped falling out and looks very nice. I would recommend this product to anyone who wants to take care of his/her hair. It is a great product. And shipping was super fast!! Gotta love that part also!
The bottle sprays a fine mist of water instead of doing a stream like some spray bottles. I've had no problems using it.

The soap does leave your skin feeling clean, although it really doesn't set itself apart from other alternative choice/boutique soaps, such as Dudu-Osun or Tarocco. I havent really noticed any upgrade from those two in particular, which i use regularly. In fact, with the Dud-osun especially, i have found that this Jericho bar doesnt compete well at all...it doesn't clear your pores as well, although the drop off is admittedly negligible, which brings me to my two main issues with this soap, given that fact. Price and scent....it cleans almost as well as the aforementioned two brands, but is priced higher ($8 for this 4.4 oz bar vs the same $8 for Tarocco's 5.2 oz bar or $10 for 4 Dudu-osun 5.29 oz bars). Additionally, this soap actually smells like mud, which cant be said for any other one i've tried. That isnt really pleasant, and i feel for the price, there should be some sort of compatible aroma outside of just simple mud scented. For all those reasons, i knocked two flippin' stars off my rating, but three stars aint bad, and reflects the quality regardless of how poorly it stacks up next to other similar products.So, I'm not trying to dissuade you from trying this soap. It is very good. I just feel you will find plenty of comparable soaps that are more pleasant and less expensive. Personally, i expected more out of it.

My mother-in-law first told me about this product and bought some for me to use. I have been hooked ever since. It not only dries my nails faster, but it also gives them an extra nice shine. Definitely recommend it.
I love Satin Color, it's not harsh on your hair and never dries it out. I've used this product for 4 yrs ,it's Great.

After I randomly saw a color I REALLY liked on some girl at the mall, I've been trying to find a similar color for myself and THOUGHT i had found it with Re-Fresh Mint. I looked up images of this color online to be sure, and although it looks like it has a greenish hue on most of the images, IT DOES NOT. If you imagine mixing a light blue color with something to add a SLIGHT HINT of a greyishness to it, then you add a tad of that to just straight up white, this is how I imagine you'd come up with this color. It's very light and has a definite BLUEish hue. I wish it was the green I was looking for, but it's not. And I can't tell if I'm just disappointed that it wasn't the color I was looking for, or if it just doesn't look good on ME, but I added a picture to the review so you can see for yourself. I'm hoping it grows on me...
I expected more from this gloss then what I got. It doesn't go on the best and isn't very sparkly. Not the best quality. If it were cheaper it would be more worth it.

I have loved this fragrance for forty years. The last bottle I bought was near the end and I no longer live near my fragrance shop. I saw it on Amazon and thought "yeah"! It is nothing like the wonderful scent it should be.. There is an unpleasant, metallic sort of finish to the scent. I looked into returning but found it couldn't be done. I am stuck with an expensive bottle of disappointment.

I guess I should have read the reviews first. Thist is not Aloe Vera Gel. It's just watery aloe vera. Like the stuff you can drink as a supplement. Disappointing. I wanted something that would soothe my adult acne, but sadly, this just fell right off my face. Amazon shouldn't call this aloe vera gela when the bottle just says "aloe vera."

I ordered a bottle of Aqua Di Gio from the seller DOLE PERFUME as a christmas gift. It was painfully and embarrassingly obvious that this is a fake version of the cologne. The smell is nowhere near the same. The ad did not advertise this as being an imitation anywhere and I am more than disappointed. BEWARE!!!

i always use different products every month because i can never find one that i like enough to stick with. when i bought this...i put it on every morning after washing my face and just after 4 days my skin was glowing and healthier looking. i then got the "visibily even" face wash and even though iv always had problem-free skin now just after 2 weeks using this stuff my skin has become even more radiant, glowing and healthy looking.

So i just bought this product, just to try it and see if it actually worked. I got home and was excited to play with my new toy. I tried to put it in my microwave, but sparks started flying! I was horrified, especially since they claim that the container is microwave safe. Just to be sure it wasn't just my microwave acting up, i put a cup of water in it, and nothing happened. I tried the container of wax again, and the sparks flew once again. So i cannot tell you if this product works, because i can't even heat it up to try it.Sally Hansen Eyebrow, Face & Lip Wax, Microwaveable

I love this product. It does everything you want it to: disguises blemishes, evens out the skin tone, creates a good foundation for further makeup, gives the skin a warm looking shade, and stays looking natural all day long. It doesn't melt off your face in the heat, or rain. This makeup isn't not shiny or sparkly either. I've encountered several foundations and bases with shine or sparkle intended to make your skin have a "natural shine, or glow" and it just looks bad. This makeup looks completely natural looking, as long as you get the right shade (try and test a little bit if you can) for your skin tone. Just I don't think this would be the solution for acne. It will cover a couple blemishes but it's not really meant for acne. I'm really glad that I bought this makeup though, it's worth your money, and you'll be happy!

I have sampled this product in Saphora and it was so much better than the bottle I received through this vendor.I believe this bottle is either old or not the real product. I am very disappointed but the scent is still one that remains on the body for over 4 hours and is not unpleasant.
I have used this product for five days and my skin is severely red and irritated. It provoked further breakouts and the areas that aren't broken out are red. Don't buy!!!!

I bought this after an accidental siting at a health food store. I saw this on a lot of womens fotki hair albums and they swore by it. I had reason to believe that this would work for my hair because a lot of women w/ my same texture loved what it did for their hair.My hair is REALLY thick so I am heavy handed when it comes to oils and pomades so I really slathered this one on. Unfortuantely this really did not moisturize or condition my scalp, add shine, or improve the condition of my hair. My scalp sucked this up, within a matter of hours my scalp was dry again, like I had never put any on to begin with.On the plus side I did see some extra growth as a result of the horsetail which conains a high concentration of natural sulfur. Besides the growth there was nothing special enough about this product to make me purchase it again. I still have a third of the jar left.fyi: my hair texture is 3c/4a/4b

The powder has a sheen to it and doesn't apply as good as the Pyscns fourmula I get at the store. I have mixed bare minerals w- other mineral powder to diminsh this sheen look whick added cakey-ness. Although it has great coverage, the sheen and cakey-ness made it seem not so natural looking. I'm very surprized I didn't care for it after I've heard so many grat things from other people on the infomercails.thanks for the quick shipping and great price...regaurdless of my feelings of the product itself.Kim

I know it's called intense red but man is this color INTENSE. wayyy too intense. Think bozo the clown but with a more cherry hue. I felt like when I looked in the mirror I looked at my hair before I even looked at my face. And when I walked PAST a mirror all I saw was red red red. Dont get me wrong, I love different and funky but not this dang bright. This was too much. My suggestion to you if u must see to believe? Buy some color oops at cvs beforehand and have it ready to use in case u feel the same way I do (which is what i did, only I didn't buy it beforehand).
This was the first ceramic iron I used. Good for first timers since it is inexpensive and does a nice job. It doesn't get as hot as some, and doesn't heat any faster than a regular iron.
my wife loves it and the night light is very nice. she uses it every day and finds it really works good

I love the opi shatter. Teenage dream is a nice color but its very very sheer and hard to tell you have it on but it is very sparkly and shiny and looks pretty on. So if your not looking for a very sheer color do not order it or just use it on top of another color.

This mineral makeup is great for people with problematic skin. I have a few skin disorders that create redness, dryness, and reactions to the sun and heat. When applied in the appropriate manner and after well-dried moisturizer, this product (which is the only I have found with a shade light enough for my skin) covers beautifully and locks in moisture while still allowing my skin to breathe. I usually don't apply the powder to my nose, the one oily area of my face, but when I apply a finishing powder after the mineral powder, it covers my nose. I can't use the rice setting powder from Youngblood though, as it is too drying, but this mineral foundation is wonderful!

I should have listened to the previous reviewers. This curling iron is so big that it straightens the mid section of the hair and curls like a blow dryer on the bottom of the hair. It heats up very quickly and it holds my hair. However, I was looking for loose curls. I suppose now I am going to give the 1 1/2" curling iron a try.

This is a great heavy-duty quality tool. It has a good weight in your hand when using it. If you have ingrown toe nails and don't want to go to the podiatrist to get toe surgery, this is the next best thing. It is a unique tool that you will not find in any kit. As a runner I can't say enough good things about this tool.
the brush was not of typical OPI quality, it had a few bristles sticking out oddly. Love the color though.
I really like the feel and the long lasting affect of this aftershave. My wife says she likes the fragrance.

So I bought this exact one from Amazon and used it for exactly a year, but then it broke. It just stopped working. Like others have pointed out, the warranty is void if you purchase it through Amazon so you have to take your chances I suppose. Before it broke it worked perfectly though!

My hair felt awesome after the application of this product.I used "Golden Brown", and it covered my gray.Next time I'll use "Golden Blonde", for more "blonde" color as opposed to "reddish" golden brown.Surya Henna Cream left my hair very silky and in excellent condition.I left it on my hair an hour with heat. I kept the plastic cap that came with the product because it really retains the heat well.This product is .... sooooooo good!I LOVE it!!

The item pictured is not the item I received. I love these rollers and I wanted the exact same thing when I reordered them. Instead I got them with plastic clip ons instead of metal pins. The plastic clip ons don't fit in the roller case and don't hold the hair as well. They are a nuisance to travel with. It took awhile to track down the people who sent this to me for a refund as there was no receipt included in the package. Too bad because the original rollers are great.

This hairdryer was nice enough while it lasted. It was small and lighweight, and did a good job of drying my hair quickly and without frizz. But I bought it on January 10th of this year, and here it is April and it's already dead. If it had even lasted a year, it might have been worth the price...but three months? I'll never be buying one of these again.
I HAVE NOT HAD TO USE THE PRODUCT FOR LICE, AS I GOT THEM UNDER CONTROL. I HOPE I WILLNOT HAVE TO USE IT FOR THAT CONDITION, BUT WILL TRY TO USE IT FOR CLEANSING

The actual brush is good but they fall off after a few uses. We have found this common with any backbrush we have purchased. Now we just take the brush off and glue them on with crazy glue or liquid nails.

The worst hair color product I've ever used!! This didn't cover any of my grey, and I only have a little at my hairline and by my temples. The scent is overwhelming! So bad, my eyes watered and it took my breath away. I color regularly so I'm aware there will be an odor but this is unreal. It was also difficult to saturate all my hair. I will pay a little more and go back to John Freida foam, a bit more money but a much better product!
Works great heats fast easy to travel with since it has the lock on the side flaws tips get extremely hot
When it came I noticed it was too dark for updating my hair. so I never used it but I never sent it back. perhaps someday I will use it.

I have used this Hermes product for years. I was a bit suspicious that this was the genuine product, given the price, but I gambled anyway. It is clearly not the real thing. Although the fragrance is similar or the same, the longevity after application is maybe an hour. The real Hermes product has a fragrance that lingers all day after a very limited application. You can spray and spray tons of this stuff, and the fragrance will only last an hour or so. Therefore, you're better off spending more and buying directly from Hermes, as their real product will last much longer. This product is a complete fraud.

I have both the white and black shatter nail polish. I absolutely love them both! I would say black is more for light colors or bright colors, but white is definitely flexible with some lighter, softer colors and bright or dark colors! Long lasting and adds a cool effect to your nails easily and without the need to go to a nail salon as often. (not that us girls would mind going every week, right? Haha)The only reason I did not give this product 5 stars is because it kind of cakes up after quite a long time and many, many uses. Nothing that would keep me from buying again, though.Overall, definitely worth a try! And you get quite a bit of product for the price too!
I have been wanting this set for a long time and now that i have it....well, the fragrance is very good but not long lasting.
I used this faithfully for ten months. My hair has been thinning a little for 2 years. I did not really notice any thicker hair, possibly a little???? but not much if at all.

I LOVE this soap! I use it for shampoo, shaving, body wash/soap, laundry, cleaning, and hand soap. I bought foaming soap dispensers and it works great! For shampoo I use it full strength but I don't need much at all! I am happy that the ingredients are organic and I LOVE that I am supporting an AWESOME company! I have other Dr. Bronner's products (chapstick, leave in hair cream, hair conditioner, other scents of the Castile soaps) and I LOVE them ALL!

Well, I ordered this because I must have seen the infomercial on TV a trillion times already and they finally broke me down enough to try it. I didn't dislike it, but didn't notice any difference in my hair from using my regular shampoo and conditioner. It's too expensive to buy again, but I would certainly do it if they ever start selling it at a cheaper price - it takes less time for sure and the smell is pleasant. It left my hair as shiny as always and it felt soft and manageable too....but then again, my regular products do the same thing.
Love it, its light has a vanilla scent, it's not a winter perfume its a summer perfume. I am giving this scent 3 stars because it does not last long on me, but its worth the try

Ungaro III EDT is one of the most unusual & interesting scents in my collection. I find I neither love or hate this scent; just unusual.I don't often wear this fragrance.At first application, an explosion of booze aroma heralds my olfactory senses. The dry down settles into a dark, melancholy, earthy, spicy, very masculine aroma. If the essence of Gothic could be bottled, Ungaro III would be it. I recommend Ungaro III in cooler weather as an after-hours or an executive boardroom fragrance.Sillage is moderate, and lasts about 4-5 hours on me before fading.
